inn1.comm: Rankin stays over the wicket, that's a tight line, tight in across the lefthander who defends on the back foot
Bray shapes to swish into the leg side, misses, and the ball thuds into his pads. a semi appeal, but it pitched way outside the line
Bray well forward to block, the ball was full and swung gently towards the off
Bray beaten all ends up by one that pitched on off and swung past the outside edge. 78mph ...
loud and raucous appeal, Bray thrust his pad at the ball with his bat following behind. The swing might have taken that past the off stump, but a good shout
again Bray plays with his front pad and then his bat, this time the ball was a fraction wider and so no appeal
short of a length, outside off, Porterfield not remotely tempted
better line, Porterfield back and defends into the leg side
angled across Porterfield who lets it go
Porterfield into line and pushes to midwicket
Porterfield stands tall and pushes the ball defensively to mid-off
another one that Porterfield allows to pass through to the keeper.
good line, Bray forward to block solidly
tight stuff from Vaas, Bray can do no more than lunge forward to defend
Bray defends to mid-on and is out of the blocks like a greyhound ... Jayasuriya is slow to react and what could have been a dangerous run turns out to be alarm free
Porterfield plays the ball straight, so much so that it trickles into the stumps at the non-striker's end
Porterfield takes a stride or two to get to the pitch and flicks it over midwicket, it clears the fielder who catches it just inside the rope
another big stride, this time from Bray, but he misses and the ball bobbles into off side off his pads
lovely start to the over, swinging away from Porterfield who whips his bat out of the line just in time
fuller, a bit on a indifferent shot from the batsman and the ball bobbles back to the bowler in his follow through
firm drive to mid-off, middled but not enough va va voom to beat the fielder
Porterfield drops into the leg side and sets off for a quick single, the burly Bray is slow to respond and has to race for safety. An earnest chat follows
Bray defends, again with his bat behind his front pad. That could get him into trouble before long
this time his pad is well in front of the bat, and a loud appeal from fielders and bowlers ... good decision from Billy Doctrove as the ball was heading over the top, but Bray's tactics are suspect
thick edge, not controlled, but it drops short of the slips and bounces between them
Bray's first assertive stroke, Vaas gives him the width he thrives on and he stands up and larrups that through the covers
wide again, but Bray leaves that and it bounces out of the keeper's gloves
Bray forward with bat and pad together, into the off side and the cover cordon sprints in
Vaas drifts to leg, Bray shapes to flick through square leg, misses, and the ball bobbles behind square for a leg bye. He was off balance, almost falling over, as he played the stroke
good end to the over, Porterfield leaves it but it was close enough that his decision came late
Bray takes a big step down the track and launches that over midwicket, well struck and four all the way. The pitch holds no demons and the two batsmen have worked that out
firm drive to extra cover
outside off stump, a tad short, Bray aims an expansive drive, head in the air, and no surprise he missed
Bray plays with his pads again, another loud appeal, again Doctrove unimpressed
and again. Bray is defending with his pads and the Sri Lankans keep appealing ... the suspicion is that sooner or later, one will go their way
looks for an off drive, a thick inside edge flies into the leg side
Vaas on the spot at the start of his fourth over, Mr Dependable
pushed gently to mid-on
Bray drives to Murali, calls for the run and then is almost run out as he is caught ambling. The throw, however, misses by some way
outside off, good take
he looks to punch off the back foot, but is undone by movement off the seam and it beats the edge
again too leg-side, off the pads and the ball squirts behind square
middle-and-leg, flicked with real power from the shoulders, all along the ground to deep square leg
Bray whips the ball off his legs through square leg and over the rope. He picked that up really early and executed the shot well
Maharoof overcorrects and Bray smashes the ball through the covers, it went like a tracer bullet. Enthusiastic cheers from the sparse crowd
slower ball, Bray gets a leading edge which loops into the off side and Arnold races in from cover and takes a good catch diving forward, inches from the ground
confidently, if slightly stiffly, forward and into the off side

short of a length outside off, no foot movement and Sangakkara takes an oh-so-routine catch. Two balls, no runs ... the experiment of promoting Botha up the order might not be seen as a complete success ...

the normally cynical office leap up as one at a quite brilliant one-handed catch from Sangakkara.  Eion Morgan nicked the ball, Sangakkara was heading to leg, but readjusted and dived to his left, clutching the ball in the fingertips of his left hand. It was almost past him as he grabbed it. Amazing
After the excitement, back to the clam of a tight delivery from Vaas
flicked round to long leg
O'Brien stands tall and plays a deliberate shot down to third man
Vaas struggling a bit for line this over, this time he strays to leg and Porterfield glances the ball fine ... no chance for long leg to get round to cut that off
outside off stump, Porterfield leaves it alone
Vaas ends a mediocre over with a good delivery
outside off, steered along the ground to gully
O'Brien upright, punches into the off with a shout of "wait there, wait there". And Porterfield did just that
into line and watchfully defended into the ground
O'Brien again right behind the line
shaped an off drive, the bat twisted as he played the shot and the ball squeezed to mid-on
short of a length, O'Brien defends
driven to extra cover and two fielders wait for each other to stop it ... and neither does
better fielding this time ... Kulasekara smiles
outside off stump and Porterfield watches it pass
Porterfield blocks on off stump - 78mph for speed freaks among you
full toss outside off stump, Porterfield doesn't punish it and completely mistimes a drive
steered through the gap in the slips, all quite controlled and an easy single
good line and length, well defended
worked round the corner on the leg side
played with an open face to point (81mph)
pushed into the covers
shorter, O'Brien up on tip-toes to defend
slower ball, almost a yorker but outside off, patted to cover
turned off middle-and-leg stump to midwicket
much the same shot but this time he works the ball to the right of a diving midwicket, mid-on scurries round to mop up
O'Brien into line, all very correct and MCC Coaching Book
angled to point. O'Brien wisely opting to consolidate for a while after that top-order wobble
O'Brien once more angles the ball to point, carbon copy
firm drive straight back down the track, well fielded by the bowler who moved swiftly to his left
clipped to leg, off the pads, and an easy run
short and wide, flat batted - more of a tennis double-handed forehand - into the covers and a quick single thanks to early and clear calling
whipped into the leg side, but straight to midwicket ... 82mph
shortish, Porterfield stands up and gets an outside edge, but a thick one and it drops well short of any close fielder
indifferent and ill-timed drive to extra cover
full, and well-placed drive to the left of mid-on, that allowed the single. With some quicker running on the first - and a decisive call - they should really have got the second
angled into the left hander from around the wicket, patted to midwicket
change of angle, outside off and played into the covers
on off stump - good variation from the bowler - and blocked
Porterfield takes a big stride to meet the ball, but he can do no more than push it back to Kulasekara
Porterfield steps back and whips the ball into the on side, but square leg is onto it quickly
another tight over completed by Kulasekara
dropped ooh and he comes dancing down the pitch, pumping it aerially just to the bowler's left who gets a paw on it but can't hold on...parrying it to mid-on. Very difficult chance
firmly defended out to cover, but it's a no-ball from the big man
very neatly struck indeed, on the front foot, but straight to mid-off
and the bowler just loses his line a touch here, drifting it down the leg side and allowing O'Brien to knock it to leg for a single
that's a much better line from Maharoof, just outside off and angling in with the angle. It's firmly defended
blocked out once more on the front foot, firmly so, and it's scooped up by mid-off
ooh he's squared him up here, a terrific ball on off stump which the batsman tries to work to leg but gets a leading edge which falls just short of cover
a play-and-a-miss outside off to one which jagged back into him quite markedly. He came forward, quite confidently, but just couldn't cope with the movement
just short of a length, but still he comes forward to defend; it's straighter, too, and he blocks it out quite firmly
a forward defensive of Boycott-like solidarity
less Boycott this time, chopping it off the back foot and almost inside-edging it. Cramped for room
that's more the O'Brien we've seen in this tournament, coming forward on the front foot to a straight delivery and driving it with fluency to cover. But straight to cover
angling into the batsman who defends it on the front foot
straight, worked to leg but straight to midwicket
straighter still from Maharoof, in fact it's even drifting down the leg side and this time he does get it away, nudging it calmly behind square for a single
better delivery, defended with his bat rather waftily away from his body. Safe enough, but not altogether convincing
tighter delivery on off stump and he comes forward to defend
full and straight, and he comes forward once again to defend

goddim. A frustrated sort of shot, skipping down the pitch and trying to flick him over midwicket. But he got a leading edge to Jayasuriya at mid-on who only had to jog back three or four metres to take a simple catch
but he starts with a wide down the leg side
confidently forward by the right hander who turns him to leg with a neat flick of the wrists

goddim! A beautiful delivery, albeit not very well played. On off stump, angling across the left hander and turning further away from his meek defensive poke, handing the keeper an easy catch just to his left
and he pads his first delivery away
gone! Oh dear. Carroll tried to sweep but lost his balance and the doosra from Murali crept beneath his bat to knock over leg stump
left alone outside off
and Johnston defends this quicker ball on his leg stump
full but just wide of the off stump and it's defended on the front foot
this rather spits up at the batsman who plays it down into the covers
ooh very nicely bowled, angling into the batsman at yorker length and it's dug out by Doug

what a piece of work that is! That's quite brilliant. Punched back to Maharoof who dived to his right, plucked it out of the air and threw down the stumps in one fluid motion. It actually ricocheted off Johnston's boot. Sri Lanka have been so slick in the field today
well bowled again, angling into the right hander who blocks it out on the front foot with a great deal of wariness
and it's defended once more to end the over
another leading edge; another wicket. He tried to turn it to leg but the spin was too great...the ball flies to Jayasuriya at mid-on who takes a useful catch diving forward
ooh and he's nearly bowled around his legs here
a vast appeal from the raucous Sri Lankans as Dave bat-pads this to silly point who dives forward to claim a non-catch
great work from Dave who just picks this up and lofts it over long-on for four
defended on the front foot
tries to work it to leg but can't get hold of it
just short of a length and he goes back to defend, pushing it out to point
a clever idea, the slower ball, but it wasn't perfectly executed; a looping full toss which he picked off to leg
and he comes forward to defend but it's a bit clunky, the ball bobbling out onto his boot
ah that's better, a firm punch on the front foot. No run, mind. But a super piece of punching
very well bowled again, giving the batsman absolutely nothing and it's blocked out
ever so slightly wider, swinging into the right hander who is once again forward
and he raps him on the pads as he tries to work it to leg
a quicker ball on middle-and-off which he clamps down on, reasonably confidently
and it's dropped: an attempted sweep and he gets a top-edge, the ball ballooning to Maharoof at deep square leg who runs in, makes excellent ground but shells it at grass level
oh dear. He shoulders arms, attempting to pad it away and he's trapped absolutely plumb in front. Mark Benson, the umpire, raises his finger as quick as a cat...almost before Murali appealed, even
on leg stump, padded away
Rankin lunges forward before leaving it alone outside off
crashed on the front foot out to extra cover who is quickly down to field
very full and straight, he comes forward to defend it out
bosh! That is massive from Dave. A front foot slap over midwicket, like a golf swing, and it hammers into the blue plastic seating
a full toss here which Langford-Smith smudges through midwicket along t'turf this time
but he loses his line here, drifting it down the leg side and Rankin whips it to leg
a fishy waft outside off. A fishwofft, if you like
Dave comes down the pitch before deciding to sweep. Sangakkara takes it excellently and whips off the bails, but Langford-Smith just gets his bat back in time
pushed out to cover on the front fot
ah, terrific shot from Langford Smith. Almost shades of Tom Moody there, skipping down the pitch and hammering it through midwicket
off the pad and it balloons to silly point. Everyone appeals but the umpire is disinterested
lofted to long-on's left for a single
ooh a play-and-a-miss from Rankin but the keeper can't hold on.
"how wozzat?" asks Murali as Rankin is rapped on the pads but it pitched well outside leg
swinging into the right hander - an excellent slower ball and Maharoof appeals once, but then retracts. And follows it with a very effeminate squeak. Neither impress the umpire
down the leg side
again on leg stump and Rankin takes a giant step down the pitch to defend on the front foot
just a touch straighter this time and the big fella blocks it out on middle stump
well left! He probably didn't leave it, in fact, but I think Ireland deserve some praise. Lovely delivery cutting across the left hander
rapped on the pads but it's well outside his leg stump
on middle-and-off, Dave blocks it out
Langford-Smith is making this shot his own. A dance down the pitch before sweeping through midwicket
Rankin has no clue here, playing and missing to an orthodox offspinner
but he has much more clue here, lofting this over long-on for four. Top shot
ah excellent batting from Rankin here, nudging this to leg and scampering through for a single
pushed out to cover
and he plays and misses outside off. Not far away at all
typical Vaas line and length, on off stump and just threatening to shape away from the left hander who nevertheless defends it solidly
drifting down leg, off Rankin's pad. Vaas appeals in remarkable hope but that was comfortably going down the leg side
and he's rapped on the back pad, trying to pull it, and that's utterly, completely plumb

inn2.comm: Rankin stays over the wicket, that's a tight line, tight in across the lefthander who defends on the back foot
beauty, a hint of shape after hitting the seam and that shapes away from the lefthander this time, who hides his bat behind his pad
a hint of width outside off, and Tharanga presents a very straight face, of the bat that is, to press the ball without much power into the covers
short ball, hello, that pops up off the chest, the batsman taking his bottom hand off the bat
short and width, help yourself to a cut, and that's crashed straight to cover - great stop. Good stuff from Ireland
straight, and that's defended down
short, cut to gully off the back foot and that's a very tidy catch indeed!
on the button straight off, and Jayasuriya pokes his bat on that, and plays what looks like a Subbuteo flick down to mid-off - a poke with the bottom of the bat - and they dibble out a quick single
down leg, and that's very well timed indeed, a crisp flick through midwicket, a shot which always looks so elegant when executed well, as this was
lost his line there, straying down leg, the batsman gave game chase
that's much better, pushing that across the lefthander who defends forward
wide down off, and the batsman strides over with his back leg to control that well down to gully, but there's a tidy dive to stop that one in its pomp
wide down leg this time
continues to stay over, continues to find the spot down leg, and that's whipped quickly to square
too short and there's a check-drive to mid-on and a quick single
pushed up there and driven forward for a quick single
Rankin unleashes a bouncer, it would be rude not to, really, with his height. It's straight, high and easily ducked
over the wicket, by the way, short, a touch wide outside off, but he gets away with it as Jayasuriya cuts that one - a lack of timing - into the ground
ooh, that was nearly a candidate for a strangle down leg, but there wasn't a nice; unfortunately for the bowler it was also wide
top, top shot. Short, that one bounces high and sits up for Jayasuriya to open the face and flick that right up and over third man. Immense
left alone outside off - Rankin struggling with his line, too
round the wicket this time, an overstep, and that's just eased into the covers
plants that outside off, short and that's hooked into midwicket - no timing at all, but no fielder there, either
pushed right up there, at last a good line and length this over, and that's just defended down
over the wicket, a touch wide, and a single's squeezed out to the covers
outside off, driven on the up and that's taken in the covers, snapped up. That was travelling and that's a marvellous catch
down the leg side - at last he's got the line to the lefthander right, but this is now a righthander
better ball, up there on off stump, and that's dinked into the covers. There's a bit of a misfield, which runs contrary to the up-and-at-'em spirit out there
width outside off and that's flayed with an aerial square drive over point
slower ball, deceives the batsman, who comes down the pitch and gets an outside edge, and looks anxiously behind... to see the ball landed down safe
up there and that's defended forward
on a good line and length, on off, and that's defended forward

short and that's pulled easily from outside off  in front of square - taking that from right in front of his eyes and watching it all the way. Good limbo-bending from the umpire at square leg, there, to avoid getting clouted
an overstep this time

short, tucked off the back foot, just dropped down into short midwicket and there's a very quick single, good running - and he's home, even though the bail was taken off. Ah, apparently they needed the third man for that - better safe than sorry, I guess
round the wicket, and that's laced off the back foot up and over cover, and well beating the man on the boundary
outside off, a touch of width, and that's played easily to the covers
flies in with all his effort, but the ball doesn't really get up, hard as he bangs that one in, and it's defended down without too much fuss
over the wicket, up there, and that's defended down without fuss, pomp, ceremony, or similar
on the pads and that's well swished in front of midwicket for an easy two
short and dropped at wide mid-on, with an aerial drive. Oh dear, that went right through the hands, like water, or sand
just outside off and that's forward driven through long-off
slower ball, but not a vintage one, outside off and that's driven well, up and over long-off
on off, short, and that's jabbed down off the back foot with some solid foot work in there to boot
short, wide and that's worked out to just inside the boundary
outside off and that's jabbed down through gully
short again and that's a very well struck, clean six, just picked off the bottom of the bat and sent sailing over square. A neat dink, golf-shot-like
outside off and that's worked well through the gap at cover
outside off, on a very good length, sailing past the batsman, who chooses to leave the ball very early
on leg, and that's tucked well to the man inside the rope
outside off and that's defended to Johnston in the covers, who bowls the ball back to the bowler, perhaps giving himself a hint that he wants a go
short, on off, and that's pulled easily through square. Sri Lanka are making this look very very easy indeed
slower ball outside off, picked, and just driven into the covers
outside off again and that's cut down, into the ground, the batsman not timing that at all
right up there and defended into the leg side
outside off and angles that in well at the righthander, who defends down
on the money first up, right up there, and that's defended well
outside off, driven firmly to cover where Rankin closes on that one well, to his right
outside off and that's driven to the covers
outside off, again, and this time picks the gap through the covers
dragged down and that's driven into the covers
outside off and that's poked off the back foot into the covers
outside off and that's driven into (and not tino, as I just mistyped, wrong teams) the covers, ah, in front of point in fact
full toss, and Jayawardene laughs after being taken by surprise, just driving that to cover
"Bowled!" - that one came out of the back of the hand and the keeper loves it. You've got to admire the enthusiasm
dinked into the gully
short, and that's driven off the back foot through point and that's the match
